intro: Corydalis turtschaninovii f. rotundiloba, commonly known as the broad-leaf corydalis, is a variant of the Corydalis genus native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its rounded, broad leaves and delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae, which includes various flowering plants with showy blooms. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and flower structure.
